text: hello, how can I generate and set a random AES value to a property?

hello everybody and thanks for having me. I’m new to the HubSpot system and trying to figure out how to make a few pieces of a landing page better for our team. I have a few questions that I’m looking for help with and our rep sent us here, so just gonna lay these out here and see what happens.

1. is it possible to have a clear header that  displays as part of a hero image?
    a. we want a menu that navigates to tags on the page to make a 1 page style menu. 
        i. if not i will probably do it via rich text boxes and HTML
2. is it possible to negative margin pictures to make them bigger when split into two columns?
    a. I have the picture next to the column, but it won’t get bigger with negative margin, just stays the same size and moves left. 
        i. can’t change column size or the form looks off
i can also provide screenshots
Hi Anthony, can you please be a little bit more specific what you mean by "clear header". Do you  maybe have a mockup that you can share?

you can do that navigation with anchor links that you can insert via a RichText Module. If you need more styling you can create a Custom Module that has the navigation in it and then assign it to the Landing Page Template
Hi Andreas, yeah we are looking for something like this
can you share a link to see what you already have?
<https://insights.revstarconsulting.com/cloud-healthcare-solutions-it-consulting-revstar-consulting?hs_preview=emCrbqeo-75209656324>
this is the current page
2) so you have an image next to  a text or something like that? Negative Margins don´t sound like the ideal Solution, i would  solve it with CSS and Media Queries

I tried to inline CSS on the image, I also tried using the rich text editor to place the image for more manipulation potential, but can’t get it to get bigger unless I shift the column left, but that ruins the columns on the left’s spacing
this is the area in question. Also is it possible to sit form fields side by side? like 50% width for each column?
like this
yes you can arrange them side by side in the  Form Editor in HubSpot
if it is a HubSpot form that is of course
yeah it’s a HubSpot form, I will have to dive back into the editor as I didn’t see that as an option last time I was in

is it possible there is an overarching style preventing that change in the HubSpot system (I’m not the first set of hands in here and some global styles seem to be dictating pieces and parts in the builder)
you can just drag the fields next to each other until you see a green bar as an indicator
awesome, thank you
if you have a rule that tells your page to have every input field with a width of 100% combined with an !important, that would most likely overrule it
that worked wonders on the form
thank you
thought it is hard to say without knowing the exact specificity
cool

then for the “clear header navigation” if worse comes to worse i can make a faux menu in html and drop a rich text editor with a classed div to navigate to, so that one isn’t massive. (I will have to give it a go and see if it works)
thank you for your help!
You´re welcome
create a small node app and leverage <https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html|node crypto>
